    • Method Detail

      • CheckCollision

        public boolean CheckCollision()
        This function utilises the counterclockwise function to check whether or not a collision has occured. Think of two line segments AB, and CD. These intersect if and only if points A and B are separated by segment CD and points C and D are separated by segment AB. If points A and B are separated by segment CD then ACD and BCD should have opposite orientation meaning either ACD or BCD is counterclockwise but not both. Therefore calculating if two line segments AB and CD intersect is as follows: intersect(A,B,C,D): return ccw(A,C,D) != ccw(B,C,D) and ccw(A,B,C) != ccw(A,B,D)
        Returns:
        true if a collision has occurred.

      • ccw

        private boolean ccw(double Ax,
                    double Ay,
                    double Bx,
                    double By,
                    double Cx,
                    double Cy)
        This function finds whether or not three points are in counterclockwise order. A, B and C. If the slope of the line AB is less than the slope of the line AC then the three points are listed in a counterclockwise order.
        Parameters:
        Ax - A x position
        Ay - A y position
        Bx - B x position
        By - B y position
        Cx - C x position
        Cy - C y position
        Returns:
